newsitem.title: USA: US OPTIONS FOCUS - Big Fannie Mae spread with a LEAP.
newsitem.headline: US OPTIONS FOCUS - Big Fannie Mae spread with a LEAP.

text.p: An investor apparently went long a large number of LEAPS (long term equity anticipation securities) on Fannie Mae.
The heaviest individual equity options volume was in the Fannie Mae March 30 call, which traded 13,240 contracts at 9-3/4.
The Fannie Mae January 1998 30 call traded 12,740 contracts at 11-1/8.
"Somebody bought the LEAPS, 12,740 of them, for 11-1/8 and sold it looks like an equivalent amount of the March 30s at 9-3/4," said Harrison Roth at Cowen & Co.
"That's a good trade," he said. Fannie Mae shares were off 1/4 at 39-3/8 on more than 3.3 million shares in late trading.
Roth also noted that several long-term puts on Microsoft Corp were fairly active, with some of the volume likely from spread strategies.
The Microsoft January 1999 67-1/2 put traded 7,470 contracts, the January 1998 65 put traded 2,980, the January 1998 60 put traded 2,395 and the January 1999 57-1/2 put traded 2,380.
Microsoft shares gained 2-3/8 to 97-3/8 on heavy volume of more than 15.6 million shares.
Roth said some of the volume appeared to be from an investor moving out from the 1998 LEAPS to the 1999 series.
"Somebody bought the January 57-1/2's of 1999 and sold the January 60's of 1998," he said.
